result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court sets restitution of $1300.00 to Pick & Save by 4/6/2017 or civil judgment.

Court orders all court costs (including the DNA surcharges) due and owing by 4/6/2017 or 15 days in jail.
*
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor , society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence by full payment of restitution and court costs and no new arrest.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served. Huber to apply for work and work search. Sentence to begin forthwith.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Byron A Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment Notice returned undeliverable by USPS

F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
15 days HOC.
DUE & OWING.
Filed, Crime Victim Rights Request Form, Restitution Worksheet, & Crime Victim Impact Statement

Defendant Byron A Williams in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by state, defense and defendant. 
Court sets restitution of $1300.00 to Pick & Save by 4/6/2017 or civil judgment.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and work search.  Sentence to begin forthwith.  Court REMANDS the defendant.
Court orders all court costs (including the DNA surcharges) due and owing by 4/6/2017 or 15 days in jail.
*
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor , society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence by full payment of restitution and court costs and no new arrest.

Defendant Byron A Williams in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Byron A Williams in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Byron A Williams in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense to receive disovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch47/  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save at 605 E Lyon Street. Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Byron A Williams in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Defendant Byron A Williams in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Byron A Williams not in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 07-02-2015 at 01:30pm
